title: Jaeger-LeCoultre Unveils a Duo of Master Ultra Thin Watches With Grained Copper Dials
summary:
SummaryJaeger-LeCoultre introduces copper-grained dials for the Master Ultra Thin Date and MoonBoth 39mm steel models feature refined symmetry, Dauphine hands and brown alligator strapsPowered by in-house 899 and 925 calibers, each model is limited to 800 piecesJaeger-LeCoultre enriches its celebrated Master Ultra Thin collection with two new references - the Master Ultra Thin Date and the Master Ualtra Thin Moon - each distinguished by grained copper dials. The warm, softly textured copper surface contrasts elegantly with the cool polish of stainless steel cases, breathing fresh life into the timeless aesthetics of the line. Conceived as the quintessential dress watch for modern aesthetes, the Master Ultra Thin series continues to embody understated sophistication, rooted in the Maison’s legacy of ultra-thin watchmaking that dates back to the early 1900s.The new copper dials bring a distinctive character to these models, shifting in tone as light plays across their surface — from powdery softness to richer saturation. Symmetry and balance define the dial layouts, anchored by either a date display or a moon phase aperture at six o’clock. Elongated trapezoid indexes echo the sharp geometry of Dauphine hands, which alternate between satin-brushed and polished facets to create subtle visual intrigue. Completing the refined aesthetic, both watches are paired with interchangeable brown alligator straps and stainless-steel folding clasps, offering versatility alongside elegance.While united by the Master Ultra Thin’s signature design language, each reference highlights its complication with unique detailing. The Master Ultra Thin Date features a crisp white date disc framed by copper tones, powered by the in-house Calibre 899 with a 70-hour reserve. The Master Ultra Thin Moon showcases a silver moon against a deep blue starry sky, encircled by date numerals, driven by Calibre 925. Both movements are visible through sapphire case-backs, revealing fine finishes such as Côtes de Genève, bevelled bridges, and an open-worked pink gold rotor. Limited to 800 pieces each, these watches undergo the Maison's rigorous 1,000 Hour Control testing, ensuring precision and reliability while reaffirming the Maison’s commitment to technical excellence and timeless design. For more information, visit Jaeger-LeCoultre's website and boutiques.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Engineered Garments and BEAMS BOY Unite for Playful Workwear Collaboration
summary:
SummaryEngineered Garments and BEAMS BOY collaborated on a Shoulder Vest and Wrap Skirt collectionThe vest is reversible and features a customizable strap, available with playful Leopard Print and Polka DotThe collection will be available starting November 28Engineered Garments and BEAMS BOY have collaborated to launch a collection featuring a Shoulder Vest and a Wrap Skirt. This line reinterprets classic workwear and military elements from the two brands’ unique perspective.The collection includes the popular Engineered Garments Shoulder Vest, now updated with a reversible design. A new strap connects from the shoulder to the chest, ensuring comfortable wear even over outerwear. This strap can be easily removed with snap buttons, offering customizable styling for any occasion. Adding BEAMS BOY's signature playful touch, the vests are available in two distinct colorways: Black Velvet/Leopard Print and Navy Velvet/Polka Dot.Complementing the vest, the Wrap Skirt is made from the same material. This knee-length skirt features side slits, making it an ideal piece for layering over pants.The collaborative Shoulder Vest and Wrap Skirt will be available starting November 28 at BEAMS BOY stores and on BEAMS's official website.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: UNDERCOVER and nonnative Unveil "OZISM" Collection Inspired by Japanese Monk Workwear
summary:
SummaryUNDERCOVER and nonnative launched the "OZISM" collection, inspired by director Yasujiro OzuThe designs use monk workwear ("samue") and POLARTEC fleece for warmth and functionThe collection will be available starting November 22UNDERCOVER and nonnative have collaborated on the first release of their "OZISM" collection. This collection is named after Japanese film director Yasujiro Ozu, a figure respected by both UNDERCOVER designer Jun Takahashi and nonnative designer Takayuki Fuji, reflecting an appreciation for Japanese aesthetics, culture, and history.The core inspiration for the collection's design is "samue," the traditional workwear of Buddhist monks. This practical garment is worn during the daily chores and labor vital to temple life and Zen training. Drawing on this, the collection emphasizes warmth and high functionality with a minimalistic design.The lineup includes a samue-style jacket and matching pants, both constructed from POLARTEC® THERMAL PRO® fleece, a half-zip top made with POLARTEC® ALPHA® DIRECT, a stitchless down vest, and a wool beanie. Minimal branding is used, found only on the items' tags. In addition, Japanese actor Tadanobu Asano has been appointed to provide the campaign visuals, excellently delivering this heavily traditional Japanese workwear-inspired collection.The nonnative x UNDERCOVER "OZISM" collection will be available for purchase starting November 22. Prices range from ¥85,800 JPY to ¥9,900 JPY (approx. $550 USD - $60 USD). It can be purchased at all UNDERCOVER stores, the official online store, the nonnative shop, and COVERCHORD online. View this post on Instagram A post shared by nonnative (@nonnative)

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: McLaren Unveils Bespoke Vegas Inspired 750S ahead of Las Vegas Grand Prix
summary:
Summary:McLaren Unveils Bespoke Vegas Inspired 750S, dubbed ‘Project Viva’.The design uses MSO’s bespoke “Muriwai white” paint to decorate the vehicle with sleek Muriwai House and Vegas Nights motifs.'Project Viva' will be on display at the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas from November 13-20.McLaren Special Operations (MSO), is the arm of McLaren that exists purely to create visually rich, bespoke automotive designs for special commissions.The latest project from MSO, is 'Project Viva' – a custom commission of the Surrey-based automotive companies 750S in celebration of the Las Vegas Grand Prix. (The race is taking place in Nevada, US, from November 21-23 as part of the Formula One World Championships.)The design itself is wholly inspired by the city of lights. It captures the energy, skyline, architecture and signage of Vegas through a 'Sketch in Motion' line technique. Creating a predominantly monochromatic color palette, MSO's bespoke "Muriwai White" paint decorates the vehicle with sleek Muriwai House and Vegas Nights motifs. The lines are set against a deep "Black" finish with subtle flecks of "Cyan", "Magenta" and "Green", designed to capture the vibrant glow of Las Vegas at night – creating a museum worthy aesthetic finish that is steeped in storytelling and nods directly to the energy of the Grand Prix.Adding a personal touch, McLaren's Lando Norris and Oscar Piastri also had input on the design. The pair added the team's tenth Constructors' World Championship star on the rear bumper, celebrating its recent win, alongside signature lines and individual sketches.Project Viva will be on display at the Wynn Hotel in Las Vegas from November 13-20Scroll up to see the final design.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Chipotle and Nike Craft an Exclusive Air Force 1 for the Doernbecher Freestyle Programm
summary:
SummaryNike partnered with Chipotle to create a unique Air Force 1 for young patient-designer Oli Fasone-LancasterThe design is inspired by Chipotle's food and packaging, celebrating Oli's treatment ritualThe shoe, which is not for public sale, features text referencing Oli's 572 hospital lapsFollowing last month's announcement of the Doernbecher Freestyle 21 Collection, Nike has partnered with Chipotle, the favourite restaurant of one of the collection's young patient-designers, ten-year-old Oli Fasone-Lancaster. This collaboration has resulted in a unique custom-made Air Force 1 created exclusively for him.Oli was diagnosed with cancer in kindergarten and endures long hospital stays and chemotherapy. To help cope with the overwhelming treatment, he established a tradition of celebrating the end of each session with his preferred Chipotle meal. This personal ritual served as the inspiration for the Chipotle x Nike Air Force 1.The design of the silhouette is rich with details referencing Chipotle. The metallic silver overlays are inspired by the bottom of Chipotle's burrito bowl packaging, while the green Swooshes represent guacamole. Chipotle logos are prominently featured on the outer tongue and heel. The sock liner borrows the print from Chipotle's brown to-go bags, and Oli's exact food order is printed on the inner tongue. A standout detail is the text "Oli’s Order #572" on the heel tab, which commemorates the 572 laps that Oli walked around the oncology inpatient unit at Doernbecher during his treatment. Finally, the phrase "Chipotle Is My Life" is embossed on the brown rubber outsole, which mirrors the colors of Chipotle's napkins and to-go bags.The thoughtfulness of the collaboration extends to the packaging with a custom Chipotle burrito bowl and Chipotle's classic utensils with a Nike-inspired twist.While this Chipotle x Nike Air Force 1 will not be available to the public, Oli's original Doernbecher x Air Force 1 design will be released later this winter as part of Nike’s Doernbecher Freestyle 21 collection.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: MM6 Maison Margiela and Timex Re-Engineer the T80 with a Gold-Tone Collection
summary:
SummaryMM6 Maison Margiela and Timex reunited for Fall/Winter 2025 to re-engineer the iconic Timex T80 digital watchThe collection features the T80 Gift Set and the T80 Ring Watch, both finished in a striking, classic gold-toneThe T80 watch includes the number '6' subtly encircled as a nod to the Maison’s numerical signature, with the collection available starting November 17thFollowing a successful debut, MM6 Maison Margiela and Timex have reunited for Autumn/Winter 2025 to continue their exploration of utility and form by re-engineering the iconic Timex T80 digital watch. This new chapter celebrates the space between timekeeping tradition and MM6's unconventional perspective.The collection features two cult favorites, the T80 Gift Set and the T80 Ring Watch, both returning in a striking, classic gold-tone finish. This material expression offers a quiet yet radical subversion, perfectly aligned with MM6's history of transforming the ordinary into idiosyncratic essentials.The T80 Gift Set features a 34mm polished stainless-steel case and a brushed and polished gold-tone bracelet. Its mirrored mask, hidden beneath a mineral lens, displays the digits 0 to 23, with the number '6' subtly encircled as a homage to the Maison's numerical signature. The watch retains the T80's classic functionalities, including the chronograph, daily alarm, and the signature INDIGLO backlight.Similarly, the T80 Ring Watch is reintroduced in a sleek gold finish. Designed to be worn on the finger, the polished stainless-steel case and brushed expansion band redefine the very gesture of how time can be worn. This minimal yet distinctive collection reflects MM6’s design ethos rooted in spontaneity and self-expression.The MM6 Maison Margiela x TIMEX collaboration will be available starting November 17th via the Timex and MM6 webstores, as well as selected stores.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Marimekko Unveils Festive Holiday Gift Sets for Christmas
summary:
SummaryMarimekko is launching two holiday gift sets on November 21Each set includes five items, such as a limited-edition Unikko tote bag and a metallic mug setThe gift sets, available in red and blue, are sold exclusively on the Marimekko Japan online storeMarimekko is launching its "Merry holiday moment - Wrapped with festive joy" campaign to celebrate the approaching holiday season. As part of this campaign, the brand will release two special holiday gift sets, perfect for treating loved ones or oneself.Available in two color options, red and blue, each gift set contains five items, including a limited edition tote bag featuring the iconic Unikko floral pattern. Additionally, the set includes a Unikko mug set in a striking metallic gold and chic burgundy, a piece of cut fabric with a unique print design, a holiday message card and a sticker sheet.Each Marimekko holiday gift set is priced at ¥16,500 JPY (approx. $110 USD) and will be available exclusively on Marimekko's official Japanese online store, starting November 21.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast

title: JJJJound x Descente Fall 2025 Collaboration Is All About Urban Utility
summary:
SummaryJJJJound and Descente Allterrain unveiled an extensive Winter 2025 collection inspired by construction and utility wearThe line features a full range of layers, combining a versatile muted color palette with sharp accents like Realtree® camoDesigned for functional, off-mountain daily use, the collection releases globally on November 27 and 28JJJJound is once again partnering with Descente to release a comprehensive Fall 2025 collection, evolving their mountain-inspired heritage into a full range of functional, everyday layers. The collaboration draws heavily from the rugged aesthetics of construction gear and essential utility wear, resulting in pieces seamlessly integrated into daily life.The collection is remarkably expansive, featuring key outerwear pieces like a Down Jacket and Hardshell Parka, alongside versatile layers such as a Reversible Jacket and Vest, Hardshell Pants, and foundational apparel like a Button-Up Shirt and Warm-Up Longsleeve. Accessories, including a Crossbody Bag, Duffle Bag, and various hats and socks, complete the full utility system.The core aesthetic focuses on easy-to-style layers achieved through a versatile, muted color palette. This quiet foundation is intentionally punctuated by sharp, functional details, including bold graphics, authentic Realtree® camo patterns, and strategic, vibrant branding hits. This tension between subtle and statement ensures the garments work just as well in the city as they do off-mountain.The collection's fusion of comfort and durability will be available globally on Thursday, November 27 at 5 p.m. EST on JJJJound, followed by a release on Friday, November 28 at 11 a.m. GMT via the Descente's online store. View this post on Instagram A post shared by JJJJound (@jjjjound) View this post on Instagram A post shared by JJJJound (@jjjjound)

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: SKIMS Unites With Cactus Plant Flea Market for Limited-Edition Holiday Capsule
summary:
SummarySKIMS and Cactus Plant Flea Market (CPFM) unveiled their first limited-edition holiday capsule collectionThe collection fuses SKIMS' loungewear with CPFM's bold, unconventional aesthetic and spans women's, men's, and kids' sizesThe campaign, featuring North West, was shot by Harmony Korine and drops on November 20SKIMS has unveiled its first-ever limited-edition holiday capsule collection in collaboration with the cult-favorite brand Cactus Plant Flea Market (CPFM), creating an unexpected and unmistakably bold union of two cultural forces. This special capsule reinterprets SKIMS' signature loungewear and sleepwear silhouettes through CPFM’s playful, unconventional, and irreverent lens. The result is a fusion of cozy, elevated basics with an unconventional aesthetic, designed to deliver creativity and must-have collectibles just in time for the holiday season.The collection spans women's, men's, and kids' sizes , with pieces available in sizes XXS to 4X. Fans and collectors can anticipate bold loungewear and statement sets that blend CPFM’s iconic graphics with classic SKIMS styles, featuring a festive array of colors and prints. The campaign, brought to life by Harmony Korine, stars a diverse cast including Ken Carson, Beabadoobee, Madeline Argy, Mariah the Scientist, and North West. Kardashian noted that having North West in the campaign made it particularly special.“Having North in this campaign makes it really special for me; she brings so much personality to the pieces,” said Kim Kardashian, Co-Founder and Chief Creative Officer of SKIMS. “Our collaboration with CPFM brings a fresh, unexpected twist to holiday loungewear, with pieces that are iconic, playful, and expressive.”Check out the collab above. The SKIMS x Cactus Plant Flea Market collection will be available for purchase in-store and online via the SKIMS webstore on November 20.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Watch Adam Sandler Sit Down With David Letterman in Trailer for ‘My Next Guest’ Special
summary:
SummaryDavid Letterman will sit down with Adam Sandler for a special episode of My Next Guest Needs No IntroductionThe discussion will cover Sandler's career, from stand-up and SNL to his record-breaking success with Happy Gilmore 2The episode will premiere exclusively on Netflix on December 1David Letterman is preparing to sit down with the versatile talent Adam Sandler for an upcoming special episode of the Netflix series My Next Guest Needs No Introduction with David Letterman. The standalone special will offer an intimate conversation with the Emmy, Golden Globe, and Grammy Award-nominated actor.The episode's logline reveals that the discussion will delve into Sandler's impressive trajectory, spanning his early days in stand-up comedy, his time on SNL, and his eventual rise to movie stardom. Sandler, who is currently earning acclaim for his performance opposite George Clooney in Noah Baumbach's Jay Kelly, recently broke an opening weekend record with the successful sequel Happy Gilmore 2.Watch the trailer above. The special is set to premiere on December 1.

Read more at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Gufram Revives Keith Haring’s Luna Luna Carousel Seats
summary:
SummaryGufram collaborates with Luna Luna to reissue Keith Haring’s carousel seats as collectible design piecesThe Dog and Crawling Baby are recreated in soft polyurethane with Guflac® finish for domestic useGufram, the Italian pioneer of Radical Design, has announced an exclusive new collaboration with Luna Luna, the first artist-designed amusement park, to present a re-edition of an iconic work by Keith Haring. Haring, whose art is celebrated for its accessibility and bold Pop Art sensibility, originally created a carousel for the visionary Luna Luna amusement park in Hamburg nearly four decades ago. That project transformed his signature two-dimensional line drawings into dynamic sculptural forms, animating seats and panels with playful figures that embodied both irony and poetryFollowing the reopening of Luna Luna at The Shed in New York, Gufram has reimagined two of Haring’s carousel seats — the Dog and the Crawling Baby — as collectible design objects. Crafted in soft polyurethane and finished with Gufram’s proprietary Guflac® coating, the pieces translate Haring’s carnival-inspired imagery into domestic settings.This release continues Gufram’s tradition of bridging art and functionality through collaborations with leading creatives. From partnerships with the Andy Warhol Foundation to projects with Snarkitecture and TOILETPAPER, the brand has consistently challenged design conventions with irony, provocation, and imagination. By merging the artist’s playful motifs with Gufram’s radical approach to material innovation, the collection turns the concept of amusement into functional design, offering a fresh way to experience Haring’s visual language.For more details, head over to Gufram’s official website.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: BEAMS Unveils Levi's 501 Limited Edition "Dark Indigo" Colorway
summary:
SummaryThe Levi's 501 BEAMS Limited Edition in "Dark Indigo" will be released on November 21, 2025, exclusively through BEAMSThe jeans feature selvedge denim with a single wash for luster, and a comfortable straight fit with a slightly higher riseThe design incorporates vintage details, including the coveted "BIG E" red tab, a button fly, and a traditional leather patchA transatlantic partnership renews tradition as Levi's and Japanese retailer BEAMS unveil a highly sought-after, limited-edition run of the iconic 501 jean in an exclusive "Dark Indigo" colorway.This collaboration elevates the classic silhouette through meticulous craftsmanship and authentic heritage details. The denim is true selvedge, woven on old-fashioned shuttle looms, and treated with a single wash to reveal a distinct, elegant luster and substantial firmness. This process ensures the denim retains its character while offering a refined feel from the first wear.The fit is a thoughtful update to the original: a straight cut featuring a slightly higher rise that grants a relaxed, comfortable silhouette with added room through the thighs and knees. It successfully bridges vintage proportions with a modern, effortless drape.Adding to its collector status are period-correct vintage accents, including the coveted "BIG E" red tab, a classic button fly, and the traditional stitched leather patch. As a strict BEAMS exclusive, this premium 501 will be available only in 28-inch and 30-inch lengths. This release is a celebration of denim history, engineered for the contemporary enthusiast. The "Dark Indigo" is set to drop on November 21, 2025 online and in-store.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: The 10 Most Hyped Films of 2026
summary:
2026 is shaping up to be an exciting year in film. The cinematic battlefield will see the biggest franchises, the most ambitious auteurs and the most talented A-listers clash for your time, attention and box office dollars. From long-awaited superhero showdowns to prestige epics and the return of cult favorites, next year's slate is absolutely stacked. We've cut through the noise, ignored the speculative whispers, and curated the 10 films that are a must-watch in 2026.The Mummy Release date: April 17, 2026The mere prospect of Blumhouse and New Line breathing new life into The Mummy franchise has created a stir powerful enough to send tremors through ancient Egyptian tombs — and perhaps even rouse Imhotep himself. Although details are scarce, The Mummy 4 is rumored to bring back original franchise stars Brendan Fraser and Rachel Weisz. Matt Bettinelli-Olpin and Tyler Gillett, also known as Radio Silence, are set to direct, and the new installment will supposedly ignore the events of the third film released in 2008.MichaelRelease date: April 24, 2026Biopics can be tricky, but director Antoine Fuqua's retelling of Michael Jackson's career is looking pretty promising. Michael sees the King of Pop's real nephew Jaafar Jackson step into his uncle's Florsheim penny loafers, and will follow the story of Jackson's beginnings with the Jackson 5 and his journey to global superstardom. The teaser trailer offers a quick look at what fans can expect, and even shares a glimpse at Kendrick Sampson as the late Quincy Jones. Viewers were quick to praise Jaafar Jackson's resemblance and embodiment of Michael, with many hoping the biopic will stray from the genre's formulaic nature.The Devil Wears Prada 2Release date: May 1, 2026Alright everyone, gird your loins! Meryl Streep, Anne Hathaway, Emily Blunt and Stanley Tucci are all coming back for The Devil Wears Prada 2. Helmed by original director David Frankel, the upcoming sequel will see Miranda Priestly (Streep) go head-to-head with former assistant Emily (Blunt), who now works as a top executive. In the midst of Miranda's impending retirement and the decline of print, she battles with Emily for those important advertising dollars. The first teaser for The Devil Wears Prada 2 promises the same levels of high fashion, glamor and drama that made the first film a cult favorite.The Mandalorian and GroguRelease date: May 22, 2026Pedro Pascal is putting Din Djarin's helmet back on for The Mandalorian and Grogu, a Lucasfilm that serves as a continuation of The Mandalorian series on Disney+. The film takes place after the fall of the Galactic Empire (around five years after Episode VI – Return of the Jedi), with Mando and Grogu joining the New Republic. Joining Pascal in the cast are Sigourney Weaver as Ward, a colonel and leader of the New Republic and Jeremy Allen White as Rotta the Hutt, son of Jabba. Turns out a fourth season wasn't the way for Jon Favreau.Untitled Steven Spielberg UFO ProjectRelease date: June 12, 2026Steven Spielberg and UFOs? Count us in. Details for this still-untitled sci-fi project are minimal, but a cast made up of Emily Blunt, Josh O'Conner, Colin Firth, Colman Domingo and Wyatt Russell is enough to get us seated. David Koepp wrote the screenplay based off a story from Spielberg himself, and footage that was previously previewed hinted at action-packed sequences.Supergirl View this post on Instagram A post shared by James Gunn (@jamesgunn)Release date: June 26, 2026James Gunn is building on the success of 2025's Superman (starring David Corenswet in the titular role) with 2026's Supergirl. The film will source its material from Tom King and Bilquis Evely's comic book miniseries Supergirl: Woman of Tomorrow, and will see Milly Alcock reprise her role as Kara Zor-El/Supergirl from Superman. The self-titled DCU film will follow Supergirl as she travels across the galaxy on her 21st birthday, where she meets a young girl and experiences a situation that puts her on a path of revenge.The OdysseyRelease date: July 17, 2026We would be amiss if we didn't include Christopher Nolan's adaptation of Homer's ancient Greek epic, The Odyssey. Adding to the filmmaker's hype is a stellar cast: think Matt Damon, Tom Holland, Anne Hathaway, Zendaya, Lupita Nyong'o, Robert Pattinson, Charlize Theron, Jon Bernthal, Elliot Page, Mia Goth and more gracing the same screen. The director, fresh off his Oppenheimer triumph, is shooting this film entirely on IMAX's 70mm film cameras to capture the mythic scale of Odysseus's perilous ten-year journey home after the Trojan War. With promises of sweeping real-world locations and a budget to match the legendary scope, the film is already being hailed as the next major cinematic event, blending classical literature with the uncompromising realism that defines a Nolan epic.Spider-Man: Brand New DayRelease date: July 31, 2026Just a few weeks after The Odyssey, Tom Holland and Zendaya will return to our screens as young Peter Parker and MJ in Spider-Man: Brand New Day. The fourth film in the MCU Spider-Man series picks up where No Way Home left off — leaving a lonely Peter who loses his girlfriend and friends in order to keep his superhero identity a secret. Also reprising their roles the MCU are Jacob Batalon as Ned, Jon Bernthal as Frank Castle/Punisher, Charlie Cox as Matt Murdock/Daredevil, Mark Ruffalo as Bruce Banner/Hulk and Michael Mando as Mac Gargan/Scorpio. Meanwhile, Sadie Sink and Liza Colón-Zayas are set to join the cast.Dune: Part Three View this post on Instagram A post shared by DUNE (@dunemovie)Release date: December 18, 2026Denis Villeneuve is closing out his Dune adaptation with the release of Part Three. The trilogy closer will adapt Frank Herbert's Dune Messiah, which takes place 12 years after Paul Atreides (Timothée Chalamet) began ruling as Emperor. Still guided by his visions, Paul faces political conspiracies, as well as fertility issues with his wife Princess Irulan (Florence Pugh) and Fremen concubine Chani (Zendaya). Seeing as how captivating Part One and Part Two both were, many are optimistic about the space opera epic finale.Avengers: DoomsdayRelease date: December 18, 2026December 18 will mark a double Florence Pugh feature with Avengers: Doomsday premiering on the same as Dune: Part Three. The audience's return to the Avengers series will mark their first since 2019's beloved Endgame, and will feature a slew of old and new MCU faces: Chris Hemsworth, Vanessa Kirby, Anthony Mackie, Sebastian Stan, Letitia Wright, Paul Rudd, Wyatt Russell, Tenoch Huerta Mejía, Ebon Moss-Bachrach, Simu Liu, Florence Pugh, Kelsey Grammer, Lewis Pullman, Danny Ramirez, Joseph Quinn, David Harbour, Winston Duke, Hannah John-Kamen, Tom Hiddleston, Patrick Stewart, Ian McKellen, Alan Cumming, Rebecca Romijn, James Marsden, Channing Tatum, Pedro Pascal and, of course, Robert Downey Jr. as Doctor Doom. In Doomsday, the Avengers, Wakandans, X-Men and Fantastic Four must team up to take down the powerful Doctor Doom and once again save humanity.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: This Nike Air Force 1 Low Is “Now Accepting All Flowers”
summary:
Name: Nike Air Force 1 Low “Now Accepting All Flowers”Colorway: Peony/Metallic Gold/White/BlackSKU: IB6644-600MSRP: $120 USDRelease Date: Spring 2026Where to Buy: NikeNike is looking forward to a beautiful spring bloom with the unveiling of the Air Force 1 Low “Now Accepting All Flowers.”The upcoming women’s exclusive, which is set to drop in Spring 2026, arrives with a leather build in a pleasant “Peony” hue. Contrasting the black panel swoosh and branding details are embroideries of lilies, sunflowers and other florals in varying colors — the shoe’s main design highlight. A similar feature is spotted on the tongue tag, with other branding on the insoles and embroidered Nike Air heel logo.The model then rests on a white midsole and outsole with matching pink laces. A gold chain with both floral and Nike charms hangs for a final sweet touch.

title: Take a First Look at Sony and Nintendo’s Live-Action ‘The Legend of Zelda’ Film
summary:
SummaryNintendo unveiled first-look images of the live-action The Legend of Zelda film, slated for a May 7, 2027 premiereThe images feature Bo Bragason as Zelda and Benjamin Evan Ainsworth as Link in costume against a "lush, natural setting"Shigeru Miyamoto confirmed filming is underway for the Wes Ball-helmed film, which is on track for its 2027 release dateNintendo has unveiled a first look at its upcoming live-action The Legend of Zelda film.The images offer a glimpse at the adaptation’s main stars: Bo Bragason, who plays Princess Zelda, and Benjamin Evan Ainsworth, who plays Link. Game designer Shigeru Miyamoto wrote on X, “Filming is underway for the live-action film of ‘The Legend of Zelda’ in a lush, natural setting.”The upcoming Zelda adaptation is helmed by Wes Ball, written by T.S. Nowlin and produced by Avi Arad and Miyamoto.Check out the images below. The Legend of Zelda live-action hits theaters May 7, 2027. This is Miyamoto. Filming is underway for the live-action film of The Legend of Zelda in a lush, natural setting, with Bo Bragason-san who will play Zelda and Benjamin Evan Ainsworth-san who will play Link (1/2). pic.twitter.com/fbadNgaDqY— 任天堂株式会社 (@Nintendo) November 17, 2025

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: ARCS FW25 Finds Beauty in Everyday Routines
summary:
SummaryARCS' FW25 range explores inspiration from everyday routines, blending comfort with elevated design and modular accessoriesSustainable innovation continues with HEX recycled ripstop fabric and expanded bag offeringsHighlights include the RYE coat, bespoke denim and modern tailoring piecesLondon-based, slow-fashion label, ARCS has unveiled its Fall/Winter 2025 collection. Female-owned and independently run, ARCS continues to push boundaries under the creative direction of founder and head designer Alice Carvill. Rather than relying on incremental updates, the label uses each season as a building block to redefine its aesthetic language, ensuring that its forward momentum remains both intentional and innovative.For Autumn/Winter 2025, inspiration stems from the beauty found in everyday routines and mundane tasks — moments of clarity that arise when the mind is free from distraction. This theme translates into garments and accessories that balance comfort and convenience with elevated design.Performance gym wear merges with office attire, while coats are styled over pyjamas, reflecting a playful yet practical approach to dressing. Intentional creasing, casual silhouettes reimagined with sophistication, and modular bags with removable sections highlight the collection’s embrace of “beautifully chaotic” style. Everyday motifs, such as keys reinterpreted as zipper pulls and embroideries, further anchor the designs in urban life.Sustainability remains central to ARCS’ ethos, with the brand continuing to collaborate with specialist textile mills at the forefront of innovation. A standout material this season is the HEX fabric, developed by a Taiwanese mill, which combines recycled ripstop with a reflective 3M thread. This technical fabric lends durability and a distinctive edge to several bag styles.Expanding its accessories offering, ARCS introduces its first holdall and two new messenger bags, each featuring modular elements like removable flaps that transform into smaller crossbody bags. Hardware updates, including beaded and key-shaped zipper pulls and black powder-coated buckles, reinforce the collection’s attention to detail.The apparel range also grows significantly, welcoming ARCS’ first woollen coat, the RYE jacket, alongside the continued expansion of its Made in Italy knitwear line. Denim pieces feature bespoke washes that mimic natural creasing, while tailoring is explored through new silhouettes such as the HOME trousers with engineered seams and invisible pockets, the asymmetrical CLEO vest and long-line SWEETNESS skirt. Modern suiting is redefined with the LEGACY jacket and FLIP skirt, offering fresh interpretations of classic forms.Check out the lookbook in the gallery above. ARCS' FW25 collection is now avaialable to shop through the brand's webstore.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: ‘Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’ Receives Record-Setting 12 Nominations at The Game Awards 2025
summary:
SummaryClair Obscur: Expedition 33 made history with a record-setting 12 nominations at The Game Awards 2025Game of the Year nominees include Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Donkey Kong Bananza, Hades II, Hollow Knight: Silksong, and Kingdom Come: Deliverance IISony Interactive Entertainment is the most nominated publisher with 19 total nods; voting closes December 10 for the show on Prime VideoThe nominations for The Game Awards 2025 have been announced, with Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 making history by receiving 12 nominations, the most for any single game in the awards' history. The video game industry's year-end celebration honors the most innovative games, studios, and creatives of the year.The highly anticipated Game of the Year category features a strong lineup, including the historically nominated Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 from Sandfall Interactive, alongside Death Stranding 2: On the Beach, Donkey Kong Bananza, Hades II, Hollow Knight: Silksong, and Kingdom Come: Deliverance II.Reflecting the ongoing cross-over between gaming and entertainment, the Best Adaptation nominees include A Minecraft Movie, Devil May Cry, The Last of Us: Season 2, Splinter Cell: Deathwatch, and Until Dawn.Sony Interactive Entertainment is the most nominated publisher this year with 19 total nods.Check out the full list of nominees below. Fans can cast their votes for the winners now through December 10th online. The Game Awards will stream live on Prime Video and other digital platforms on Thursday, December 11.The Game Awards 2025 NomineesGAME OF THE YEARClair Obscur: Expedition 33 (Sandfall Interactive/Kepler Interactive)Death Stranding 2: On The Beach (Kojima Productions/Sony Interactive Entertainment)Donkey Kong Bananza (Nintendo EPD/Nintendo)Hades II (Supergiant Games)Hollow Knight: title: Columbia x atmos FW25 Bridges Mountain and City Wear
summary:
SummaryColumbia taps atmos for a FW25 capsule fusing technwear with streetwear under the theme "Connecting the mountains and the city"Highlights include a reimagined Falmas Parker jacket with microfleece and leopard print and a T-shirt with Omni-Wick and Omni-Shade technologyColumbia is joining forces with atmos for an exclusive Fall/Winter 2025 capsule, starring a new seasonal range built around the core theme of "Connecting the mountains and the city." By merging Columbia’s technical expertise with atmos’ cultural influence, the partnership delivers versatile pieces that resonate with outdoor enthusiasts and city dwellers alike.At the heart of the collection are two key items: a blouson jacket and a technical T-shirt. The outerwear revives Columbia’s archival “Falmas Parker” design, updated with modern waterproofing technology and lightweight construction. It's accented with atmos’ original leopard print, adding a bold streetwear element, while its microfleece lining ensures warmth, while the sleeves feature integrated mesh for breathability.Meanwhioe, the T-shirt, crafted from heavyweight cotton, is engineered to resist shape distortion even with active wear. It incorporates Columbia’s proprietary Omni-Wick moisture management and Omni-Shade sun protection technologies, making it suitable for both outdoor adventures and everyday urban use.Open for pre-order now, the Columbia x atmos FW25 capsule is available through atmos and Columbia's online stores and select physical locations. The drop will be officially launched starting November 22. View this post on InstagramA post shared by atmos Japan Official (@atmos_japan)

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Nike Air Rejuven8 Returns in Spring 2026
summary:
Name: Nike Air Rujven8 "Black/Sail"Colorway: Black/SailSKU: IF5958-002MSRP: $135 USDRelease Date: Spring 2026Where to Buy: NikeName: Nike Air Rujven8 "Metallic Silver"Colorway: Metallic Silver/Voltage Green-BlackSKU: IF5958-003MSRP: $135 USDRelease Date: Spring 2026Where to Buy: NikeNike is reaching back into its most conceptual archives to bring back a favorite of the mid-2000s tech-wear era: the Air Rejuven8. This distinctive silhouette, originally designed for post-performance recovery, is set to return in Spring 2026, offering modern comfort wrapped in its signature futuristic cage design.The Rejuven8 is instantly recognizable by its breathable inner bootie encased within a unique, perforated TPU cage. This construction was lauded for its lightweight feel and exceptional ventilation. The shoe’s return will focus on two contrasting colorways that cater to different aesthetics.The "Black/Sail" iteration provides a minimalist, lifestyle-focused look, utilizing a clean black upper contrasted sharply by a classic Sail-toned midsole. This muted take highlights the complex structure without the flash, making it highly versatile.In stark contrast, the “Metallic Silver/Voltage Green-Black” option leans heavily into its Y2K technical heritage. The silver shell and black accents are explosively brightened by the Voltage Green hits, reviving the aggressive, eye-catching color blocking that defined its original release.The Air Rejuven8 evokes nostalgia and offers extreme comfort and a design that remains ahead of its time. Prepare for this unique piece of Nike innovation to land on shelves in Spring 2026.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
author: info@hypebeast.com (Hypebeast)

title: Official Look at the Nike Air Max Plus VII "University Red"
summary:
Name: Nike Air Max Plus VII "University Red"Colorway: University Red/Black-White-Metallic SilverSKU: HQ2197-600MSRP: $180 USDRelease Date: Spring 2026Where to Buy: NikeNike is reigniting the flame of the Air Max lineage with the bold introduction of the Air Max Plus VII "University Red," the latest evolution of the iconic Tuned Air technology. This shoe takes the aggressive, track-inspired DNA of the original and propels it forward with a futuristic, streamlined design.The Air Max Plus VII is immediately recognizable for its intense color application. The "University Red" hue dominates the silhouette, drenching the entire neoprene upper, molded TPU overlays, and structural cages in the fiery shade. Subtle black accents are strategically used on the outsole and the signature "TN" branding on the heel, providing a necessary contrast that makes the red pop even brighter.This model upgrades the familiar Air Max Plus aesthetic with a more sculpted midsole and a sleeker collar cut. The shoe still relies on its defining feature: the tuned Air units visible in the heel and forefoot, which promise the responsive, lightweight cushioning that has made the franchise a staple of comfort and performance since the late 90s. The updated lacing system further ensures a secure, personalized fit.

Click here to view full gallery at Hypebeast
